content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Initialize an empty string to hold the extracted Julia code
    julia_code = ""

    # Loop through each line of the markdown document
    for line in split(md, '\n')
        # If the line starts with three backticks and is followed by 'julia', it's a start of a code block
        if startswith(line, "```") && occursin("julia", line)
            # Start of a new code block - open a code fence
            code_fence = true
        elseif # If the line starts with three backticks and is followed by 'end', it's the end of a code block
            startswith(line, "```") && occursin("end", line)
            # End of a code block - close the code fence
            code_fence = false
        elseif code_fence # If we're inside a code block
            # Append the line to the julia code string
            julia_code *= line * "\n"
        end
    end

    # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from the extracted Julia code
    julia_code = strip(julia_code)

    # Join any multiple code blocks together with a newline
    return julia_code
end
```
